In order to verify the facts, we rely largely on scientific articles in the University of Denver Law Journal, the Western Reserve Law Journal and the Boston School Law Journal. The restriction is in fact a law, not an amendment, and is not limited to religious institutions. Lyndon Johnson is the thirty-sixth President of the United States, Texan, who took office when John Kennedy was assassinated in 1963. The Act stipulates that all such organizations are "fully prohibited from participating directly or indirectly in or intervening in any political campaign on behalf of (or opposing) any candidate for public elective office." This includes contributing to political campaigns and any form of public statement in favour of or against a candidate or group of candidates.
